subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
“Head cover” of the Southern [[蠻夷|indigenous]] people (''{{w|Shuowen}}''); “[[scepter]] cover” (''{{w|Zhouli}}''); “hat” (''{{w|Hanshu}}'').

Wanderwort of Southeastern and Eastern Asia. The explanation in ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' alludes to a Southern origin, hence compare {{cog|mkh-pro|*muuk|*muuk ~ muək|hat}} ({{cog|km|មួក}}, {{cog|mnw|ဒမှော်|tr=həmok||wide hat}}), {{cog|th|หมวก||hat, cap}} and {{cog|lo|ຫມວກ}}. On the other hand, this word is closely related to {{zh-m|冒|to cover; hat}}, {{cog|bo|རྨོག||helmet}} and {{cog|my|အမောက်||crest (of hair); comb}}, for which Starostin posits {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*mōk||hat}}, a derivative of {{m|sit-pro|*mō(s)||to cover}}.

Cognate with {{zh-m|鍪|metal cap; helmet}}.
